UX Engineer, Front-end development

Job Description

Are you a curious, smart, self-driven UX professional who loves the challenge of turning complex problems and constraints into elegant solutions that meet a customer’s needs? Come and join us as we work to transform Thomson Reuters into a truly Digital company. We aren’t just changing the way customers engage with us, we are transforming and re-imagining our business, by focusing on the individual user.

Our work focuses on a large portfolio of transformational efforts as we work together to deliver on the promise of making it easy to do business with Thomson Reuters. Our customers range from small entrepreneurs to large corporations and government clients across the globe. They are under a lot of pressure to ensure the products and services they purchase meet their business needs and are confident in knowing how to use them.

About the Role

As a UX Engineer, you will:

As a UX Engineer on the UX Engineering team, you’ll work closely with designers, software engineers, content strategists, accessibility specialists, product owners and researchers to develop, grow, and maintain our global design system. Come join a group of passionate design professionals, who are focused on growing and scaling an organization-wide world-class platform. You may also work on a side project initiative in addition to project work.
• Writes and utilizes web development code and ongoing support of websites ensuring compliance with industry standards.
• Updates, modifies and corrects graphical design elements on websites; corrects or recreates.
• Tests and troubleshoots to optimize the layout of materials, site performance, and compatibility with various browsers.
• May provide technical expertise across the organization.
• Analyzes and recommends solutions to root quality and/or efficiency problems.
• Creates and maintains technical documentation
• Works under direct supervision, performs maintenance on existing websites or needed enhancements.
• Provides wider feedback on performance.
• Makes suggestions for problem solutions or software enhancements, which will typically be reviewed by a more senior developer.
• Implements solutions as directed within standards
• Participates in project planning sessions with team members to analyze development requirements, provide solutions, and provide work breakdown and estimates of work.
• Typically works on multiple projects at a time and as a member of the project team(s) or as part of a specialist cross-project team on multiple developments.
• Works on larger, more complex projects during product creation phase that requires subject matter expertise.
• Provides status updates for own scope of work within projects.
• Actively participates in team and status meetings.
• Follows and/or creates website development best practices while adhering to team and industry coding standards and corporate policies.
• Create and build: Have deep experience with responsive UI design methodology and processes (user-centered and iterative design). Translate design language into a reusable code library. Create scalable and accessible components. Implement brand and animation standards. Document and communicate with project teams.
• Be part of a collaborative team: Work closely with the UX Designers, Accessibility Specialists, Content Strategists, and UX
• Researchers in a collaborative team-oriented environment to create, test and support HTML SASS components and static UI patterns. Use tools to speed up development across our entire organization. Advocate for the user’s needs while developing features that align to the needs of the user.
• Be an Effective Communicator: Share ideas, participate in peer-reviews, and exhibit strong listening skills. Justify and articulate development decisions during code reviews. You participate in brainstorming sessions with product teams, and can share outcomes using excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Be Curious & Innovative: Continuously learning next generation user experiences, technology, and contribute to process development practices. Turn user research and usability feedback into easy-to-use solutions. Gather, analyze, and synthesize UX needs for complex product and user requirements.
• Participates in user experience (UX) projects at all levels: acts as a UX project lead for medium to large projects (size and complexity).
• Advocates and represents the customer in product and platform development.
• Interprets customer and user research findings, and designs and develops effective and elegant user experiences.
• Provides creative resolution of problems or issues in order to achieve an improved future result.
• Creates, evaluates and modifies moderately complex prototypes to support evolving software application development.
• Develops user profiles, with emphasis on human error control, display issues, visual interaction, physical manipulation, and task and objective analyses.
• Develops and applies software design/usability processes in the investigation of technical problems.
• Provides UX training and mentoring to other UX staff.
• Communicates and advocates usability and product standards, practices and theories.
• Contributes to and refines establishment of department UX standards and practices.

Basic qualifications:
• Minimum 5+ years experience developing large, complex front-end web applications
• Ability to navigate ambiguity, driven for self-learning and to find solutions, challenge the status quo
• Bachelor's degree preferred; Associate degree in a technology-related field and/or experience may be considered
• Familiarity with working in Agile development environment
• Knowledge of web standards and accessibility (W3C and WCAG 2.1 AA), interaction design and user-centered design principles
• Portfolio of work and demonstration of skillset
• Knowledge of CSS driven layouts and manipulating the DOM
• Ability to create production-quality CSS, SASS, semantic HTML for complex web applications with support for mobile and tablet devices
• Implement browser-independent designs and fix cross-browser issues (Chrome, Firefox, IE, Safari) on all platforms
• Design experience with a focus on design tenants, aesthetics and detail

Preferred qualifications:
• Modular CSS, SASS
• ins and functions
• Knowledge of accessibility standards, WCAG compliance and accessible feature development
• Developing mobile and accessible features for customer-facing products and tablet devices
• Understanding of web Components, React, and Angular frameworks
• Ability to follow technical specifications and production processes
• Ability to create and update design tokens
• Ability to adjust graphics and create / optimize graphic assets as needed to complete designs
• Ability to work with source/version control software
• Aptitude to understand and build SEO/semantic solutions
• Understand iconography and SVG graphics and performance

What’s in it For You

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:
• Hybrid Work Model: Currently, as part of our COVID-19 response, our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices planning to remain remote throughout 2021. Upon return, we will embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
• Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
• Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
• Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
• Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

About Sora Schools

Sora is the virtual private middle and high school turning today’s students into tomorrow’s change-makers. We are a full-time school program accredited by Cognia, WASC, and approved by the NCAA.

Our mission is simple: build the replacement to the broken U.S. education system. No compromises, no reform. Most schools continue to do the same things they’ve always done: making students memorize content, test them, score them, and rank them. Unsurprisingly, students are losing their creativity and motivation, and are utterly unprepared to succeed in the real world.

In our virtual program, middle and high school students work on passion-based projects that they get to create and take wherever they wish. They don’t spend their school hours attending lecture-based classes and don’t read many traditional textbooks — instead, they’re building video games, writing fantasy novels, conducting scientific research, and more! They connect with industry mentors to expose them to new careers and fields of study. Students learn not only the full breadth of academic subjects but also important soft skills and subjects such as financial literacy, philosophy, and more. Our school is organized in small, tight-knit cohorts so every group of students and faculty can feel close and engaged in their community. We’ve embarked on our journey to accelerate students toward their wildest dreams. We can’t wait for you to join us!

The Role

We are looking for a Senior User Interface Designer to drive the next stage of Sora's digital platform design.

The platform is critical in delivering an innovative educational experience to students as well as serving the needs of parents, teachers, and staff. As a senior visual designer, you will be responsible for designing for Web and Mobile, and establishing a design system from the ground up. You’ll also influence visual language, branding, marketing, and the end-to-end student, parent, and teacher experience at Sora beyond just digital touch-points.

Sora is in-process of rebranding and redesigning all its digital touch points - this is the best time for a designer to join the team to innovate and design educational experiences that are delightful and compelling.

We are also scaling product design, service design, visual design, and the research team from the ground up. In this role, you will work closely with the Head of Design and Chief Product Officer and alongside some of the best minds in the industry to build something that no one has built before: a digital school that is the most loved high school in the U.S, and one day the rest of the world.

Location and Salary

This is a fully remote position located anywhere in Mexico. We’re excited to build a team with a wide variety of perspectives and backgrounds, and encourage candidates to apply even if they don’t have experience in all the following areas.

We offer a competitive salary and perks based on the in country localized market.

#LI-Remote

What you'll do:
• Work day-to-day with a cross-functional team of engineers, data scientists, producers, and marketing managers to support various communication, marketing, and product visual design needs.
• Work in partnership with UX designers to craft pixel-perfect designs that are intuitive, delightful, and ready to be implemented.
• Incrementally build the platform visual experience at various stages; Lead visual design thinking, UI mockups, storyboards, and share deliverables with stakeholders.
• Design, contribute and maintain the Sora design system.
• Communicate cross-functionally and advocate for the users at all organizational levels.
• Contribute, collaborate and grow with a talented and devoted team to improve the education system in the US and globally.

What we're looking for:
• 5+ years of professional experience in User Interface Design, Production Design, or related fields as an individual contributor in an agency and/or in-house creative environment.
• An online portfolio demonstrating your strong visual design craft through web and mobile projects (required in application).
• Experience designing for consumer-facing web and mobile products with a focus on visual design language, design systems, illustrations, typography, etc.
• Mastery of design tools like Figma, Sketch, Invision, and Adobe Suite.
• Strong written and verbal skills in English
• A strong lifelong passion for all things visual; someone who has a pulse on trends in design, education, arts, and tech.

And the following traits are an added bonus:
• Motion graphics/animation skills are a major plus for this role.
• Experience in photography, photoshoots, and video production.
• Passion for print and communication design (Posters, SWAG)
• Experience contributing, improving, maintaining, and implementing design systems.
• Experience in designing for the education sector.

Working at Sora Schools

Sora offers a collaborative, team-oriented environment with colleagues who deeply care about our mission. We’re fully remote with members living around the world, offer all full-time team members stock options, and believe in flexibility to ensure we can all live a full life.

Equal opportunity statement

Sora Schools is an equal opportunity employer that is deeply committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, age, gender, religious or political beliefs, national origin or heritage, marital status, disability, sex, sexual orientation or gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy, status as a protected veteran or any characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion not only reflects our values but also enriches our ability to do our work.

Summary/objective

The UX/UI Designer reports to the VP Product Engineering. As the UX/UI Designer, you are comfortable leading the user experience and interface design of existing and new applications. Our ideal candidate will be comfortable managing timelines, planning the UX/UI process from start to finish and determining the best design methods for each project. You will work alongside the Product Team to understand customer pains/gains and document needs during the research phase and be responsible for the design and delivery of simple and delightful customer interfaces. You will own design delivery from proof of concepts, rapid prototypes to end state finalized designs. You will provide key insights to help with the product roadmap and be responsible for communicating findings and recommendations to key stakeholders. Your work should be informed by users, partners, research, metrics, and pragmatic judgement. The UX/UI Designer will be involved in building new product offerings from the ground up in addition to contributing to Repairify’s existing global portfolio.

• Collaborate with product managers and developers to translate user requirements and business goals into actionable design solutions.

• Solid understanding of user-centered design principles and methodologies.
• Experience conducting user research, usability testing, and gathering user feedback.

AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused pharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development, and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious disease. The UX Designer/Researcher is responsible for using research to understand what users want/ need from digital products & services then using these insights to design products that are easy, safe, and delightful to use. These products and services will include both external (patient- and/or doctor-facing) and internal colleague-/scientist-facing tools, and cover a range of platforms (devices, websites, mobile apps, etc.).

We are looking for someone who can own and run a full, end-to-end UCD process. You should have strong UX Design skills and ideally have a good working knowledge of UX research methodologies and be able to carry out user research/usability testing yourself when necessary. Working by yourself or with a Researcher, you will use qualitative/ quantitative user research studies and/or analyse data from existing research. Ideally you will have experience with a range of user research methods including interviewing and observation.

You will use the outputs of the research to inform the early design process; for example, creating personas or user journey maps. Using the available insights, you will then design the product’s high-level UX (e.g. via flows and wireframes), plus lower-level interaction designs (e.g. via interactive prototypes) which unambiguously communicate the intended product experience. While visual design skills are a plus, our team’s focus is on maximum usability, not aesthetics.

You will iteratively improve your designs based on results from usability testing (carried out by yourself or others). You will work closely with technical developers during the build process to manage compromises and ensure the best possible UX is launched.

You will find ways to measure and prove the impact and value that your research and design interventions have made to the end user and/or the business. In order to make efficient use of our resources and ensure a consistent and learnable experience across products (when applicable), you will help to create design libraries where proven design patterns and interactions are documented for future reuse.

About our Global Design Organization as Content Designer

Join us as our new Global Design Organization transforms Thomson Reuters into a truly digital-first company. We aren’t just changing the way customers engage with us, we are re-imagining our business.

To accomplish this, we are hiring curious, smart, self-driven UX Content Design & Strategy teammates who love the challenge of turning complex problems and constraints into elegant solutions that meet our users’ needs. Our work focuses on a large portfolio of end-to-end transformational experiences and products as we work together to deliver on the promise of making it easy to do business with Thomson Reuters and to use Thomson Reuters products.

About the work

Are you passionate about delivering the best experiences to customers? Do you know how to detangle customer journeys, realign them in a way that makes sense and advocate for customer and user experiences that support great content?

Our UX Content Design team crafts clear, consistent, succinct language for Thomson Reuters’ customer journey and product experiences. This is a highly collaborative team that partners closely with many groups across the organization to help bring the right UX content experience to our users – at the right time.

About the Role

As a Lead UX Content Designer withing Thomson Reuters’ new Global Design organization you will work within the UX Content team to partner with UX design, research, product, development and additional peers to drive useful, usable, and compelling UX content experiences for a selected area of focus across digital commerce, customer success, and cloud-based products/mobile apps for complex audiences in the Tax, Accounting and Legal spaces.

Interested candidates must be able to:
• Work effectively with a distributed team across several time zones
• Share a passion for words and the positive impact they can have in any internal or customer-facing output across individual contributor and leadership levels
• Think critically—not just about the right words for an experience, but about the right experience for words – and ask partners the right questions to find both
• Use previous experience, a fresh eye, and content design principles to create the best outcomes for our customers:
• Collaborate with UX content designers and researchers to attain the best outcome for all UX sprints, including providing and accepting constructive, considered insights
• Work with product and dev partners toward the best possible outcomes for our customers, our users and our business – challenge teams to lean into better UX, commit to outcomes
• Help educate the organization about the importance of UX content-/design-/research-thinking habits and the impact of cross-team engagement on user experience outcome
• Help build foundational processes, standards, metrics definition, and engagement protocols that facilitate top-value partnerships across UX, product, and development teams
• Be committed to goals, objectives and key results set for yourself, your team, organization, and Thomson Reuters as a whole
• Lead and/or participate in:
• Contributing UX content excellence to the organization’s larger design system
• Defining voice & tone elements for both disparate and connected experiences
• Influencing partner teams regarding content best practices
• Helping team members and partners align to processes around road mapping, asset storage, design system and work management tools
• Identifying gaps, and their solutions, within and across team processes
• Leading empathy/content/feature mapping and other discovery/sprint planning exercises in partnership with UX design and research
• Participates in user experience (UX) project work, typically up to moderate complexity.
• Creates, evaluates and modifies prototypes to support evolving software application development.
• May develop user profiles, with emphasis on human error control, display issues, visual interaction, physical manipulation, and task and objective analyses.
• May assist in developing design concept and implementation, providing input on user design considerations.
• Develops and applies software design/usability processes in the investigation of technical problems.
• May produce specifications describing user requirements and internal structures for assigned product in development.

Required Skills & background:

Education:

Masters or bachelor’s degree in writing, creative, marketing, technology, or related field
• 10+ years progressive professional experience including 3-5 combined years of digital content writing and/or UX content design experience
• Experience coaching/overseeing team members’ work outputs and weighing in as the final say in collaborative content review and critique sessions
• Experience evangelizing UX content writing/design within and across a complex organization to build peer and leadership advocacy
• Able to be a right hand to UX Content leadership without taking on personnel management
• Able to prepare work product for and to lead cross-content/cross-UX ideation workshops and training sessions
• Engaged approach to simplifying complex ideas into narrative-driven outcomes and influence
• Experience creating ideas for and presenting same in a compelling manner to VP-level and leadership teams related to progress, path forward, process improvements, etc.
• Understand the importance of primary and secondary research as well as both qualitative and quantitative inputs on approach to language, tone, and content
• Ability to partner with UX research on content-related research and insights
• Desire to push the envelope on the status quo, using passion, influence, and information to include internal partners impacted by that push
• Expert understanding of agile UX approach to creative outputs and partnership with design, research, product, and development partners
• Understanding and oversight of UX content KPIs/success metrics; exposure to means/methods of measuring UX content success
• Experience with work management and workflow platforms, design/writing collaboration tools (high- and/or low-fidelity), Microsoft office applications, and document/chat/video collaboration tools to include Jira, Azure DevOps, Abstract, Sketch, Figma, Miro, Teams, Powerpoint, excel, and more
• Experience with product usage analytics tools such as Pendo, AEM, Google Analytics, etc.
• Exposure to AOTA or WCAG 2.1 AA/AAA accessibility guidelines as they relate to UX content

What's in it For You?
You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

Hybrid Work Model: We've adopted a flexible hybrid working environment for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected

Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.

Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.

Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.

Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.

Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.
